entry.title: A conversation with Dan Boneh (2016-08-01)
entry.summary: Bitcoin developers and miners recently met with Dan Boneh at Stanford to discuss various topics related to the cryptocurrency. The meeting covered a range of issues, including elliptic curve crypto, ECDSA, Schnorr signatures, signature aggregation, BLS signature schemes, pairing crypto, group signatures, block-level signature aggregation, transaction-level signature aggregation, post-quantum crypto, quantum mining ASICs, provable solvency schemes, scrypt password hashing, and balloon hashing. The transcript of the meeting can be found on DIYHPL's wiki page.
